intro: Hieracium exacutum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are narrow and often have a hairy texture, while the flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat, daisy-like cluster. Hieracium exacutum is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its role in supporting pollinators.
